reference: Becker, Gary S., Human Capital and the Personal Distribution of Income: An Analytical Approach, Woytinsky Lecture No. 1, Institute of Public Administration, Ann Arbor: University of Michigan, 1967.
Becker, Gary S. and Barry R. Chiswick, Education and the Distribution of Earnings, American Economic Review, May, 1966, pp. 358-369.
Ben-Porath, Yoram, The Production of Human Capital Over Time, in Education, Income, and Human Capital, edited by W. Lee Hansen, New York: Nat. Bur. Econ. Res., 1970.
Chiswick, Barry, Income Inequality and Schooling: A. CrossSectional Study, Mimeo., N.B.E.R., August, 1972.
Griliches, Zvi and William M. Mason, Education, Income, and Ability, Journal of Political Economy, 80, No. 3, (May/June, 1972), pp. S74-Sl04.
Hanoch, Giora, An Economic Analysis of Earnings and Schooling, Journal of Human Resources, Summer, 1967.
Hause, John, Earnings Profile: Ability and Schooling, Journal of Political Economy, 80, No. 3, (May/June, 1972).
Johnson, Thomas, Returns from Investment in Human Capital, American Economic Review, LX, No. 4 (September, 1970), pp. 546-560.
Leibowitz, Arleen, Family Investments in Human Capital, Journal of Political Economy, 80, No. 2, Part II, (March/April, 1974), pp. Slll-5l31.

Lillard, Lee A., Human Capital Life Cycle of Earnings Models: A Specific Solution and Estimation, NBER Working Paper No. 4, Mincer, Jacob, Schooling, Experience and Earnings, New York: National Bureau of Economic Research, 1974.
Mincer, Jacob and Solomon Polachek, Family Investments in Human Capital: Earnings of Women, Journal of Political Economy, 82, No. 2, Part 2, (March/April, 1974), pp. S76-Sl08.
Solmon, Lewis C., The Definition and Impact of College Quality, NBER Working Paper No. 7, August, 1973.
Taubman, Paul, Schooling, Ability Non-Pecuniary Rewards, Socioeconomic Background ..., NBER Working Paper 17, Nov., 1973.
Terman, Lewis M., The Gifted Child Grows Up, Genetic Studies of Genius, Vol. IV, Stanford, California: Stanford University Press, 1947.
Revisited, mimeo., National Bureau of Economic Research, October, 1972.
